00048 /*****************************************************************************\
00049  *
00050  *  File:   header_reader2.c
00051  *  Author: John C. Gyllenhaal, Wen-mei Hwu
00052  *
00053  *  Description:
00054  *    Reads a header file and builds a symbol table from it
00055  *
00056  *  Creation Date :  April, 1993
00057  *  Updated for hmdes2_customizer :  August, 1995
00058  *
00059 \*****************************************************************************/
00060 
00061 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00062 #include <config.h>
00063 #include <stdio.h>
00064 #include <stdlib.h>
00065 #include <string.h>
00066 #include <strings.h>
00067 #include <ctype.h>
00068 #include <library/i_error.h>
00069 #include <library/dynamic_symbol.h>
00070 
00071 #define MLINE_SIZE 4001
00072 
00073 typedef struct hparse_info_st
00074 {
00075   STRING_Symbol_Table *table;
00076   char *name;
00077   FILE *in;
00078   int line;
00079   int comment_level;
00080   int endif_level;
00081 }
00082 Hparse_Info;
00083 
00084 /* Prototypes */
00085 void Hskip_to_endif (Hparse_Info * hinfo, char *source, int line);
00086 
00087 int Hget_next_line (Hparse_Info * hinfo, char *ret_buf);
00088 void Hparse_line (char *ptr, char *name, char *arg);
00089 
00090 STRING_Symbol_Table *
00091 read_header_file (char *file_name, int print_warnings)
00092 {
00093   Hparse_Info hinfo;
00094   char buf[MLINE_SIZE];
00095   char name[MLINE_SIZE];
00096   char arg_buf[MLINE_SIZE];
00097   char *prev_val;
00098   STRING_Symbol_Table *table;
00099 
00100   /* Extra unused variables; Wall clean; 01-03-24 Sain-Zee Ueng */
00101   /* char     *arg_ptr; */
00102   /* int              i; */
00103 
00104   /* Initialize fields for parsing */
00105   hinfo.name = (char *) strdup (file_name);
00106   hinfo.line = 0;
00107   hinfo.table = STRING_new_symbol_table (file_name, 256);
00108   hinfo.comment_level = 0;
00109   hinfo.endif_level = 0;
00110 
00111   if ((hinfo.in = fopen (file_name, "r")) == NULL)
00112     I_punt ("Cannot open C header file '%s'", file_name);
00113 
00114   while (Hget_next_line (&hinfo, buf) != EOF)
00115     {
00116       if (buf[0] != '#')
00117         continue;
00118 
00119       if ((strncmp ("#define", buf, 7) == 0) && (isspace (buf[7])))
00120         {
00121           /* Break line into name and arg (if any) */
00122           Hparse_line (&buf[8], name, arg_buf);
00123 
00124           /* Make sure name defined */
00125           if (name[0] == 0)
00126             I_punt ("error (%s line %i):\n    Name expected in define ('%s')",
00127                     hinfo.name, hinfo.line, buf);
00128 
00129           /* Make sure not already defined */
00130           prev_val = (char *) STRING_find_symbol_data (hinfo.table, name);
00131           if (prev_val != NULL)
00132             {
00133               I_punt
00134                 ("error (%s line %i):\n    Redefinition of '%s' "
00135                  "(prev val '%s')",
00136                  hinfo.name, hinfo.line, name, prev_val);
00137             }
00138 
00139           /* Insert defined value into symbol table */
00140           STRING_add_symbol (hinfo.table, name, (void *) strdup (arg_buf));
00141         }
00142       else if ((strncmp ("#undef", buf, 6) == 0) && (isspace (buf[6])))
00143         {
00144           /* Break line into name and arg (if any) */
00145           Hparse_line (&buf[7], name, arg_buf);
00146 
00147           /* Make sure name defined */
00148           if (name[0] == 0)
00149             I_punt ("error (%s line %i):\n    Name expected in define ('%s')",
00150                     hinfo.name, hinfo.line, buf);
00151 
00152           /* Make sure not already defined */
00153           prev_val = (char *) STRING_find_symbol_data (hinfo.table, name);
00154           if (prev_val != NULL)
00155             {
00156               I_punt ("Someone needs to implement #undef");
00157             }
00158         }
00159       else if ((strncmp ("#ifdef", buf, 6) == 0) && (isspace (buf[6])))
00160         {
00161           /* Break line into name and arg (if any) */
00162           Hparse_line (&buf[7], name, arg_buf);
00163 
00164           /* If name not defined, skip to matching #endif */
00165           if (STRING_find_symbol (hinfo.table, name) == NULL)
00166             Hskip_to_endif (&hinfo, buf, hinfo.line);
00167         }
00168       else if ((strncmp ("#ifndef", buf, 7) == 0) && (isspace (buf[7])))
00169         {
00170           /* Break line into name and arg (if any) */
00171           Hparse_line (&buf[8], name, arg_buf);
00172 
00173           /* If name defined, skip to matching #endif */
00174           if (STRING_find_symbol (hinfo.table, name) != NULL)
00175             Hskip_to_endif (&hinfo, buf, hinfo.line);
00176         }
00177       else if (strncmp ("#endif", buf, 6) == 0)
00178         {
00179           /* Do nothing */
00180         }
00181       else if ((strncmp ("#include", buf, 8) == 0) && (isspace (buf[8])))
00182         {
00183           if (print_warnings)
00184             {
00185               fprintf (stdout, "Warning (%s line %i):\n    '%s' ignored\n",
00186                        hinfo.name, hinfo.line, buf);
00187             }
00188         }
00189       else
00190         {
00191           I_punt ("Warning (%s line %i):\n    Unsupported directive '%s'",
00192                   hinfo.name, hinfo.line, buf);
00193         }
00194     }
00195   fclose (hinfo.in);
00196 
00197   table = hinfo.table;
00198   free (hinfo.name);
00199 
00200   return (table);
00201 }
00202 
00203 /*
00204  * Skips to the matching #endif for  a #ifdef or #ifndef
00205  */
00206 void
00207 Hskip_to_endif (Hparse_Info * hinfo, char *source, int line)
00208 {
00209   char buf[MLINE_SIZE];
00210 
00211   hinfo->endif_level = 1;
00212   while (Hget_next_line (hinfo, buf) != EOF)
00213     {
00214       if (strncmp ("#ifdef ", buf, 7) == 0)
00215         {
00216           hinfo->endif_level++;
00217         }
00218       else if (strncmp ("#ifndef ", buf, 8) == 0)
00219         {
00220           hinfo->endif_level++;
00221         }
00222       else if (strncmp ("#endif", buf, 6) == 0)
00223         {
00224           hinfo->endif_level--;
00225           if (hinfo->endif_level == 0)
00226             return;
00227         }
00228     }
00229   I_punt ("%s: Hit EOF searching for the #endif matching '%s' on line %i",
00230           hinfo->name, source, line);
00231 }
00232 
00233 void
00234 Hparse_line (char *ptr, char *name, char *arg)
00235 {
00236   int i;
00237 
00238   /* Strip white space before name */
00239   while ((*ptr != 0) && isspace (*ptr))
00240     ptr++;
00241 
00242   /* Read name from buf */
00243   for (i = 0; (ptr[i] != 0) && !isspace (ptr[i]); i++)
00244     name[i] = ptr[i];
00245   name[i] = 0;
00246 
00247   ptr += i;
00248 
00249   /* Skip white space before argument */
00250   while ((*ptr != 0) && isspace (*ptr))
00251     ptr++;
00252 
00253   /* Read arg from buf */
00254   for (i = 0; ptr[i] != 0; i++)
00255     arg[i] = ptr[i];
00256   arg[i] = 0;
00257 }
00258 
00259 int
00260 Hget_next_line (Hparse_Info * hinfo, char *ret_buf)
00261 {
00262   char in_buf[MLINE_SIZE], *buf;
00263   char *ptr;
00264   int i, pos;
00265 
00266   while (fgets (in_buf, MLINE_SIZE, hinfo->in) != NULL)
00267     {
00268       hinfo->line++;
00269 
00270       /* Detect lines that are too long */
00271       if (strlen (in_buf) >= (MLINE_SIZE - 1))
00272         I_punt ("%s line %i: Line too long. Max length = %i",
00273                 hinfo->name, hinfo->line, MLINE_SIZE - 1);
00274 
00275       /* Move to pointer so we can manipulate */
00276       buf = in_buf;
00277 
00278       /* Strip leading white space */
00279       for (; (*buf != 0) && isspace (*buf); buf++)
00280         ;
00281 
00282       pos = 0;
00283       for (ptr = buf; *ptr != 0; ptr++)
00284         {
00285           /* Detect start of comment */
00286           if ((ptr[0] == '/') && (ptr[1] == '*'))
00287             {
00288               hinfo->comment_level++;
00289               ptr++;
00290               continue;
00291             }
00292 
00293           /* Detect end of comment */
00294           if ((ptr[0] == '*') && (ptr[1] == '/'))
00295             {
00296               hinfo->comment_level--;
00297               if (hinfo->comment_level < 0)
00298                 I_punt ("%s line %i: Unmatched '*/' (nesting allowed)",
00299                         hinfo->name, hinfo->line);
00300               ptr++;
00301               continue;
00302             }
00303 
00304           /* Copy info to ret buffer if not commented out */
00305           if (hinfo->comment_level == 0)
00306             {
00307               ret_buf[pos] = *ptr;
00308               pos++;
00309             }
00310         }
00311 
00312       /* Terminate ret_buf */
00313       ret_buf[pos] = 0;
00314 
00315       /* Strip trailing white space */
00316       for (i = pos - 1; (i >= 0) && isspace (ret_buf[i]); i--)
00317         ret_buf[i] = 0;
00318 
00319       /* If return buffer is not empty, return 0 */
00320       if (strlen (ret_buf) != 0)
00321         return (0);
00322     }
00323 
00324   /* Reaches here on EOF only */
00325   return (EOF);
00326 }
